video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a textured surface, transitioning to a black screen displaying the Creative Commons logo and the text "Attribution" with "CC BY" underneath. The scene then shifts to a woman standing at a podium with a laptop, speaking to an audience. She is wearing a dark blue dress and red earrings, gesturing with her hands as she speaks. Behind her, a large blue screen displays the words "horizontal hostility." The setting appears to be a conference or lecture hall, with a Creative Commons banner visible to the left of the stage. The woman continues to speak, and the screen behind her changes to display the text "if you aren't all in, you don't belong here." The video captures the woman's presentation, emphasizing her gestures and the changing text on the screen, which conveys a message about inclusivity and commitment.

The video features a woman standing at a podium on a stage, delivering a presentation. She is dressed in a dark sleeveless dress and red earrings, with her hair styled in loose waves. The podium is equipped with a laptop and a microphone, and the background is dominated by a large blue screen displaying the text "the women's suffrage movement" in white letters. The stage is dimly lit, with spotlights highlighting the speaker and the screen. To the left of the stage, a red banner with the letters "CC" and the words "Creative Commons" is visible. The audience is seated in darkness, focusing their attention on the speaker. As the presentation progresses, the screen changes to display the text "15th Amendment" in white letters, indicating a shift in the topic being discussed. The woman continues to speak, maintaining her position at the podium, with the stage lighting and audience focus remaining consistent throughout the video.

A woman stands behind a podium, delivering a speech. She is dressed in a dark blue sleeveless dress and wears red earrings. Her hair is dark and shoulder-length. The podium is equipped with a laptop and two microphones. The background features a large blue screen, and the setting appears to be a formal event or conference. The woman's facial expressions and body language suggest she is engaged in her presentation, occasionally looking down at the laptop and then back up, likely addressing the audience. The lighting is focused on her, highlighting her as the central figure in the scene.

A woman stands at a podium, delivering a speech. She is dressed in a dark blue dress with thin straps and red earrings. The podium has a laptop on it, and there are two microphones positioned in front of her. Behind her, a large blue screen displays the text "15th Amendment" in white letters. The setting appears to be a conference or seminar, with a banner on the left side of the stage that reads "Creative Commons." The woman gestures with her hands as she speaks, occasionally placing her hands on her hips. The audience is visible in the foreground, seated and facing the stage. The lighting is focused on the speaker, highlighting her against the dark background. The overall atmosphere is formal and professional.

The video features a woman standing at a podium on a stage, delivering a speech to an audience. Behind her, a large screen displays an illustration of Lucy Stone, accompanied by the text "Lucy Stone" and "Abolitionist & Women's Rights Pioneer." The image is credited to "Bust Comics." The woman, dressed in a black outfit, gestures with her hands as she speaks, emphasizing her points. The stage is dimly lit, with a spotlight on the speaker, and the audience is seated in darkness, focusing their attention on her. To the left of the stage, a banner with the letters "CC" and the words "Creative Commons" is visible. The atmosphere is formal and attentive, with the audience engaged in the presentation. The screen then transitions to display a quote from Lucy Stone, which reads: "I do not know what bloodshed may come by it. All I do know is, that with have no right to keep a Union with slaveholders. Slavery shall be abolished, or the Union shall be dissolved." The quote is attributed to Lucy Stone, reinforcing the theme of her advocacy for abolition and women's rights. The woman continues her speech, maintaining the same posture and expression, as the audience remains focused on her and the message being conveyed.

The video features a woman standing on a stage, delivering a speech at a conference or event. She is positioned behind a podium, with a large screen behind her displaying various quotes and images. The first quote on the screen reads, "I do not know what bloodshed may come by it. All I do know is, that with have no right to keep a Union with slaveholders. Slavery shall be abolished, or the Union shall be dissolved." - Lucy Stone. The screen then transitions to an image of Audre Lorde, followed by another quote attributed to her: "It is learning how to take our differences and make them strengths. For the master's tools will never dismantle the master's house. They may allow us to beat him at his own game, but they will never enable us to bring about genuine change." The audience is visible in the foreground, attentively watching the speaker. The setting is a dimly lit auditorium with a focus on the stage, creating an atmosphere of concentration and engagement. The Creative Commons logo is visible on a banner to the left of the stage, indicating the event's affiliation or sponsorship. The speaker's gestures and expressions suggest she is passionately delivering her message, emphasizing the importance of the quotes displayed on the screen.

The video captures a woman standing at a podium on a stage, delivering a speech to an audience. She is dressed in a white top and black pants, with her hair pulled back. The stage is lit with blue spotlights, and a large screen behind her displays the text "The free software and open source movement maybe" in white letters on a blue background. To the left of the stage, there is a red banner with the "CC" logo, representing Creative Commons. The audience is seated in the darkened room, attentively watching the speaker. The setting suggests a formal event or conference focused on the topic of free software and open source movements. Throughout the video, the scene remains consistent, with the speaker continuing her presentation and the audience maintaining their focus on her.

The video features a woman standing at a podium on a stage, delivering a presentation to an audience. The stage is dimly lit, with a large screen behind her displaying various graphics and text. Initially, the screen shows a blue background with white icons: a keyhole with a checkmark, a beer mug with an 'X', and a checkmark next to the beer mug. The woman, dressed in a sleeveless top and dark pants, gestures with her hands as she speaks. To her left, a red banner with the letters "CC" and the words "Creative Commons" is visible. The audience is seated in darkness, focusing on the speaker and the screen.

The presentation progresses with the screen changing to display the text "The Masters of Open Source" in white letters on a blue background. The woman continues her speech, maintaining her position at the podium. The red "CC" banner remains visible, and the audience's attention is still directed towards the speaker and the screen.

In the final part of the video, the screen shows a quote in white text on a blue background: "...when we saw the success that open source was having, it served as a guiding light to us." - The Budapest Open Access Initiative. The woman continues to speak, gesturing with her hands, while the audience remains focused on her and the screen. The stage lighting and the red "CC" banner remain consistent throughout the presentation.

The video features a woman standing on a stage, delivering a speech at a conference or event. She is positioned behind a podium, with a large screen behind her displaying a quote attributed to "The Budapest Open Access Initiative," which reads, "...when we saw the success that open source was having, it served as a guiding light to us." The quote is presented in blue text on a white background, with quotation marks at the beginning and end. The stage is dimly lit, with blue spotlights illuminating the speaker and the screen. The audience is seated in the foreground, facing the stage. To the left of the speaker, there is a banner with the logo "CC" and the text "Creative Commons" beneath it. The atmosphere suggests a formal and professional setting, likely focused on discussing open-source initiatives and their impact. The video transitions to a new slide on the screen, displaying the text "what our masters built" in white letters on a blue background, indicating a shift in the presentation's topic or theme. The speaker continues to address the audience, maintaining the same posture and demeanor throughout the video.
